Class Quaternion

java.lang.Object
Quaternion
public class Quaternion extends Object
Represents a quaternion, a mathematical structure used in 3D rotations and complex number extensions. A quaternion is expressed as: q = a + bi + cj + dk, where a, b, c, and d are real numbers.

  • Constructor Details

    • Quaternion

      public Quaternion()
      Default constructor. Creates a quaternion with all components set to zero.

    • Quaternion

      public Quaternion(double a, double b, double c, double d)
      Constructor to initialize a quaternion with specific values.
      Parameters:
      a - The real part of the quaternion.
      b - The first imaginary component.
      c - The second imaginary component.
      d - The third imaginary component.

    • Quaternion

      public Quaternion(double angle, double[] axis)
      Constructor to initialize a unit quaternion representing a rotation.
      Parameters:
      angle - The angle of rotation in radians.
      axis - A 3D unit vector [x, y, z] representing the rotation axis.

  • Method Details

    • Re

      public double Re()
      Returns the real part of the quaternion.
      Returns:
      The real component (a) of the quaternion.

    • Im

      public double[] Im()
      Return the imaginary part of the quaternion.
      Returns:
      A 3-element array [b, c, d] representing the imaginary components.

    • setRe

      public void setRe(double real)
      Sets the real part of the quaternion.
      Parameters:
      real - The new real component of the quaternion.

    • setIm

      public void setIm(double[] imaginary)
      Sets the imaginary part of the quaternion.
      Parameters:
      imaginary - A 3-element array [b, c, d] representing the imaginary components.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the array does not have exactly 3 elements.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the quaternion.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A string in the format "a + bi + cj + dk".

    • isUnitQuaternion

      public boolean isUnitQuaternion()
      Checks if this Quaternion is a unit quaternion (norm = 1). It must take in count the unaccuracy of double type.
      Returns:
      true if the Quaternion is unitary, false otherwise.

    • add

      public void add(Quaternion q)
      Adds another quaternion to this one.
      Parameters:
      q - The quaternion to add.

    • multiplyBy

      public void multiplyBy(double r)
      Multiplies this quaternion by a scalar value.
      Parameters:
      r - The scalar value to multiply by.

    • multiplyBy

      public void multiplyBy(Quaternion q)
      Multiplies this quaternion by another quaternion.
      Parameters:
      q - The quaternion to multiply by.

    • determinant

      public double determinant()
      Computes the determinant (or norm squared) of the quaternion.
      Returns:
      The determinant value, computed as a² + b² + c² + d².

    • norm

      public double norm()
      Computes the norm (magnitude) of the quaternion.
      Returns:
      The norm of the quaternion.

    • normalize

      public void normalize()
      Normalizes this quaternion to make it a unit quaternion.

    • conj

      public Quaternion conj()
      Computes the conjugate of the quaternion.
      Returns:
      A new quaternion representing the conjugate (a, -b, -c, -d).

    • rotate

      public double[] rotate(double[] vector)
      Compute the rotation of a 3D vector using this Quaternion. The formula is v'= q*v*q^(-1) with q this Quaternion and v' the rotated vector.
      Parameters:
      vector - A 3D vector represented as an array [x,y,z].
      Returns:
      The rotated vector as an array [x',y',z'].
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the array does not have exactly 3 elements.

    • sum

      public static Quaternion sum(Quaternion q1, Quaternion q2)
      Computes the sum of two quaternions.
      Parameters:
      q1 - The first quaternion.
      q2 - The second quaternion.
      Returns:
      A new quaternion representing the sum of q1 and q2.

    • multiplicationByScalar

      public static Quaternion multiplicationByScalar(double r, Quaternion q)
      Computes the multiplication of a quaternion by a scalar.
      Parameters:
      r - The scalar value.
      q - The quaternion to be scaled.
      Returns:
      A new quaternion representing the scaled quaternion.

    • multiplication

      public static Quaternion multiplication(Quaternion q1, Quaternion q2)
      Computes the product of two quaternions.
      Parameters:
      q1 - The first quaternion.
      q2 - The second quaternion.
      Returns:
      A new quaternion representing the product of q1 and q2.

    • inverseOf

      public static Quaternion inverseOf(Quaternion q)
      Computes the inverse of a quaternion, if it has a nonzero determinant.
      Parameters:
      q - The quaternion to invert.
      Returns:
      A new quaternion representing the inverse of q.
      Throws:
      ArithmeticException - if the quaternion has a determinant of zero.
